attributes.action: Establish a support body to advise and protect Beneficiaries of Wills and Trusts
attributes.background: Support body to provide free help and advice to beneficiaries:  To ensure proper estate administration.  Advising on; confusing Will language, dwindling estate concerns, uncertainty of legal rights, high executor fee charges, lack of transparency or information, unresponsive administrators etc.
attributes.additional_details:
This support body (funded by increase in Probate tax) to:-

•Provide legal advice to beneficiaries in clear and simple terms   
•Ensure executor accountability 
•Have powers to take action against executors to protect beneficiaries where there are failings in responsibilities and duty of care.

We ask for Parliament to change the law, ensuring that executors are legally bound to clearly inform beneficiaries of the existence of this body and provide its contact details with Will delivery.

attributes.action: To arm all police officers with handguns
attributes.background: I believe all police officers should be armed with handguns for officers protection. Over the last 2 years terror attacks have become increasingly regular and some could have been stopped with a simple shot from an officer. It will add security to the job of law enforcement and act as a deterrent
attributes.additional_details: In America it has been seen that police can be attacked and that a handgun can prevent that. It can also bring an end to criminal situations much faster.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of dogs in pet shops and introduce stricter licensing requirements.
attributes.background: Puppy farms breed masses of dogs for profit with little regard for their welfare. Many dogs in pet shops come from these puppy farms, so by banning their sale it will help drive them out of business.
attributes.additional_details: The legal limit of litters per bitch should also be lowered from six to four, to protect the health of the mother. It should be mandatory for the buyer of a puppy to first see the dog at home with its mother. This should crack down on the reselling of dogs through a third party.

attributes.action: Stop hospitals from charging blue badge holders parking in hospitals
attributes.background: As if people with disabilities don't have enough to worry about without some hospitals now charging them to park. People on disability are an easy target and often have to visit hospitals frequently through no fault of their own and to start charging them to park is a disgrace.
attributes.additional_details: We need to put an end to this and support the disabled not punish them for their disability. This can only be seen as greed and it needs to be sorted out now.

attributes.action: Ensure that no claimant on benefits is left without financial support.
attributes.background: I am hearing about families losing their homes and needing to use food banks due to a sudden removal from one set of benefits to the new one:- universal credit. It can't be right - the benefits should run seamlessly into each other. This is totally inhumane.
attributes.additional_details: This has happened to someon I know with a disabled child.

attributes.action: Codify the requirement for parliamentary authorisation of military action.
attributes.background: Since 2003, and Parliament's decision to vote in favour of military intervention in Iraq, it has become an accepted convention that Parliament will authorise military action in which British Forces will participate.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst military action is often justified and neccessary, it should not be in the power of PM to unilaterally decide when and where to deploy British Forces. Since 2003, convention has been followed by succesive governments that Parliament should be consulted on military action, it appears that this convention will now be ignored. It is therefore neccessary that this requirement is enforced via statute. Such a statute could include exceptional circumstances whereby action could be expedited.

attributes.action: Only allow students to register to vote in one constituency
attributes.background: In the 2017 general election students registered to vote in their town and university town. I would like them to only be able to register to vote in one constituency in general elections.

attributes.action: Change the official name & branding of the House of Lords to the House of Peers
attributes.background:
While over 25% of the members of the House of Lords are women, the name erases their existence, ignores their achievements and puts a gendered restriction in the heart of our nation's Parliament.

By changing the official name to the House of Peers, along with all branding, we can fix this mistake
attributes.additional_details: Today is International Women's Day 2018, sixty years since women were first allowed to sit as peers. If we could change our Parliament's name by IWD 2019 to include the 209 female peers who help make our country's laws, that would be a wonderful celebration of 60 years of women in British democracy.

attributes.action: Make Debeaking Illegal in the egg and meat industry
attributes.background:
Debeaking is the partial removal of a chicken's beak, commonly used in the egg industry.

It has been proven that a chickens beak is highly sensitive as it is highly nervated (Davis,2004) it has also been proven chickens then have trouble eating as a result of this.
attributes.additional_details:
Debeaking is banned in Sweden, Finland, Norway (Picket H, 2008) Austria (The Ranger, 2014) and Denmark (Farming UK, 2015a). A ban was due to come in force in 2011 but it was postponed until 2016 and is still legal today.

Let's help these poor chickens!

attributes.action: Serious injuries caused by careless driving should lead to imprisonment.
attributes.background: People's lives are completely changed for the worst due to drivers lack of care on the road. Victims of this often result there pain in suicide, leaving a large strain on not only the victims' lives but the people around them.
attributes.additional_details: Drivers do not deserve to walk away freely from the pain they have caused.

attributes.action: Vote for whether there should be another EU referendum
attributes.background: HM Government says that if there is another referendum, then Democracy is broken. Therefore, I am calling for a vote on whether another referendum should take place, which means Democracy is not broken as the people have chosen to have another referendum if it is voted for.
attributes.additional_details: This means that the government must hold another referendum as the people of the nation voted for it, and must not neglect democracy. Lies were made in the campaign for Brexit, and politicians have not been held accounted for that. I personally believe that false hope does not represent democracy and there was no transparency. Furthermore, the people did not know what they voted for and they have the right to vote again, now they understand consequences. You must ask the people to vote again.

attributes.action: Intervene in the slaughter of stray dogs in Russia preceding the 2018 World Cup.
attributes.background: The 2018 FIFA Football World Cup will take place in Russia in June and July. In an attempt to “ensure security and a pleasant stay” and “provide a good image” for visitors, thousands of stray cats and dogs and even birds in host cities are being killed.
attributes.additional_details:
Russia lacks a humane system of shelters, food and medical support for homeless cats and dogs. However, contracts worth $1.95million have been signed in host cities to kill the animals rather than set up shelters or provide spay/neuter and vaccinations programmes. 

Russia must withdraw all contracts and cancel planned slaughter of hundreds of thousands of animals.  

WE ASK OUR GOVERNMENT: Contact the Russian Government and demand the passing of animal protection laws and redirect any foreign aid to support humane solutions to remove stray animals from the streets.

https://www.facebook.com/groups/bloodyFIFA2018/

attributes.action: Exempt Commonwealth soldiers and veterans from paying fees for naturalization
attributes.background: Foreign commonwealth soldiers and veterans should be exempt from paying fees during naturalisation, life in the U.K. test, and language test as long as they have served for the minimum contract required and have qualified for the length of stay required.
attributes.additional_details: After serving in the British Army from commonwealth countries, you’re still required to undertake life in the U.K. test, language test and also pay the fee required for naturalisation. This is very sad after you have put your life on the line to serve in the queens army to defend the British well being.

attributes.action:
Mandatory signs on all disabled facilities -
"Not all disabilities are visible"
attributes.background: Since developing a chronic urinary disease, I have found myself needing to use disabled facilities often. However, due to not bearing any obvious or visible disability and only a hidden one, I have faced criticism and been confronted on many occasions as to why I am using such facilities.
attributes.additional_details:
Myself and thousands of other people who suffer from unseen disabilities are having to defend ourselves and on many occasions show proof as to why they need to use disabled facilities. 
When I am in need to use the disabled loos, I have often been confronted by others. This is discrimination.

I am petitioning for all disabled facilities in the UK to bear mandatory signs reading "Not all disabilities are visible". 
This is to aim to put a stop to such discrimination and prejudice.

attributes.action: Introduce 'reading dogs' to all primary schools in England
attributes.background: Research shows that children can get very stressed with reading aloud in class. Reading to dogs is a good way of stopping children feeling scared - dogs do not make comments or tell you off for getting things wrong and they always listen. All primary schools should have access to a 'reading dog.'
attributes.additional_details:
The Kennel Club already run a 'Bark and Read' scheme https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/barkandread 
Lane, H.B. & Zavada, S.D.W. 'When reading gets ruff: canine-assisted reading' The Reading Teacher 2013, 67(2) p. 87-95

attributes.action: Lest we forget! Fly Union Flag all year round to mark centenary of end of WW1
attributes.background:
Next year marks the centenary of the end of the Great War.
As a mark of respect to the fallen who made the ultimate sacrifice so we could be free, we believe that the Union Flag should be flown on all Government buildings for the whole year.
attributes.additional_details:
At the going down of the sun and in the morning we will remember them.
Lest we forget.

attributes.action: We want a public enquiry into whether children are needlessly taken into care
attributes.background: More and more children are being removed from families by social services. Applications to take children into care are at record levels. We need a public enquiry to look at why this is happening and whether children are being needlessly removed from their families.

attributes.action: A Referendum on EU Leaving Deal
attributes.background: A Referendum to decide whether the EU Deal is acceptable to the British People is essential, BEFORE Exit.
attributes.additional_details: A number of petitions (rejected by Government)  have, in Government responses, been rejected "because the people voted to leave". The TERMS under which we leave are important: Deal? or No Deal?. (NOT "Stay in EU"). We MUST have a voice on HOW we are leaving!!! If no Referendum is granted, the next General Election will become a Vote of Confidence in the Government. Negotiators NEED a Referendum to make them concentrate on obtaining an acceptable outcome.

attributes.action: Ban the sale, and use of any tool designed to cause pain/fear in training dogs.
attributes.background:
After the successful banning of the shock collar - let's get tools that are inherently designed to cause pain or fear banned too. This includes but not limited to choke/prong/pinch/spray collars/devices.

There is NO place in using pain or fear to train any dog whether a pet or working.

attributes.action: Get the UK to ban all single use plastic items by 2030.
attributes.background:
Around 8 million tons of plastic enter the oceans each year, which is like emptying a garbage truck of plastic into an ocean every minute.

Governments MUST realize that the convenience of plastic is not worth the harm it causes

attributes.action: Raise the issue of using big cats as photo props with the Thai goverment
attributes.background:
Recently, tigers and lions have become the centre of a cruel and barbaric attraction. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists and celebrities.

However, these animals are drugged up and live in vile conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has worked hard at ending animal cruelty and continues to do so. However, much of Thailand is only just recognising the concept of animal welfare. The now 'in thing' to do is have your picture taken with a tiger or lion which is fuelled completely by tourists.

However, the truth behind these 'tiger selfies' is a sad and heart-breaking scene. The animals are drugged to ensure they are 'safe' to have selfies with. Furthermore, the conditions in which they are kept are cramped and filthy.

attributes.action: Make typing and full keyboard skills a compulsory part of secondary education.
attributes.background:
Children today are having to do much of their education online and on computers.  Yet they are not taught to type properly.  This leads to slow work and frustration.  
We do not give a child a pencil and expect them to learn to write. Yet we give them a keyboard and expect them to learn to type.

attributes.action: Stop non-UK residents donating money to UK political lobby groups.
attributes.background: Soros and others have their own agenda. People who don’t live in the UK should not be allowed to influence British politics by donating funds to lobby groups.

attributes.action: Have a meaningful vote on Parliamentary Petitions after a debate
attributes.background: Currently petitions from this website have no legislative effect, they are merely debated and then left in the dust. To be a more transparent democracy this should be changed such that these public parliamentary petitions may be formed into motions and potentially into law.
attributes.additional_details:
In my eyes an ideal system would be to have these petitions firstly carry on as they are; proceeding to go to debate if they hit 100,000 signatories, have the non-binding debate in parliament as is at the moment and THEN, after that debate, have all present Commons MPs vote on forming the petition into an official parliamentary motion that is then brought to the Commons Chamber.

This will create for a more direct and transparent democracy which I would hope for the government to support.

attributes.action: Stop reducing child maintenance monies by allowing travel expenses to be claimed
attributes.background: Did you know that when child maintenance monies are awarded through the CMO (previously CSA) they allow the non resident parent to claim travel expenses (regardless of how far they wish to move away) against the child maintenance award thus lowering it further. Stop disadvantaging our children.
attributes.additional_details: Child maintenance is normally sought via the CMO as a last resort when other avenues have been explored for fairness for the child. The key focus for resident and non resident parent should be THE CHILD and providing financial and emotional stability as if you hadn’t separated.  This claiming process looks to add conflict. Child maintenance was set up to aid THE CHILD. The non-resident could chose to move away 100’s of miles away yet the child would be monetarily disadvantaged as a result.

attributes.action: Scrap Part P, someone with 5 days experience is not safe to work on electrics
attributes.background: The public are being mislead on the terminology of what makes an electrician, often employing a Part P company over and approved electrician as they believe Part P is the same as Gas Safe.
attributes.additional_details:
Electrician training
3 or 4 Years ( and must have served as apprentice)
Exams;
level 2 - 6 units consisting of practical and theory exams 
level 3  - 7 units consisting of practical and theory exams
NVQ 3 - At least 1 year served and assessed by competent electrician with evidence of all areas of electrical work
AM2 - 16.5 hour exam on practical skills and theory
Regulations - online exam 

Part P Domestic Electrical Installer training
5 Days
Exams;
40min multiple choice Exam

attributes.action: Promote drug harm reduction information and services
attributes.background: There were 3744 drug related deaths in the UK in 2016. The government currently provides no official harm reduction information or services. 35% of the UK's population have taken drugs in their lifetime. The government needs to promote harm reduction information and provide testing services.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to promote harm reduction in the UK in the following ways: 
- Allow licenced premises to test drugs 
- Make drugs reagent kits readily available 
- Make pharmacies have reagents where drugs can be tested for free anonymously 
- Promote information on how to use drugs safely
- Promote information on what to do in an emergency situation for a friend or family member
These services will cut drug deaths and save the NHS money. Statistics about deaths and usage are from drugwise.org

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to leave dogs chained up outside for hours on end.
attributes.background: Imagine being chained up, especially in extreme weather conditions such as hot sun, rain and freezing temperatures. It's not the way you would treat a human being, so why do people treat dogs like this? They need the basic needs like food, warmth, shelter and love.
attributes.additional_details: I have grown up with dogs all my life, most of them rescued from homes that don't care for them properly or they're surplus to requirement. In Pennsylvania, USA, they have just passed "Libre's Law", which prosecutes owners for leaving their dogs chained outside under certain conditions. For more information: http://www.philly.com/philly/news/animal-cruelty-pennsylvania-libres-law-20170628.html?mobi=true

attributes.action: Charge all Foreign Vehicles entering the UK
attributes.background: All Foreign Vehicles entering the UK to use our roads and motorways, to be charged a one year payment, and be issued a Vignette to register for their use of our road system.
attributes.additional_details:
If most of Europe can charge for their roads, it should be done in the UK, to help our economy, by extra revenue for maintaining our road infrastructure.
As an Island Nation we have the ideal opportunity, to charge at all Ports of entry.

attributes.action: Scrap VAT on Digital Books
attributes.background: Currently, Print books are exempt from VAT, whereas eBooks are subject to tax.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the Government launched an action plan to inspire thousands more pupils to read in 2015, and that digital books are now the preferred medium for many, it makes no sense to tax youngsters whilst trying to increase readership.

If the Government are serious about tackling reading standards, scrapping the VAT on eBooks is surely one way to make a positive impact.

https://www.gov.uk/government/news/new-action-plan-to-inspire-thousands-more-pupils-to-read

attributes.action: Use 'Reverse Vending Machines' to recycle glass, plastic and cans in the UK
attributes.background:
I am aiming to achieve higher awareness of recycling in the UK, and to implement recycling further and make it easier. 
Systems such as this are already implemented in other countries in Europe, such as Germany, where they have been proven to work well, and I hope that this will work in the UK.

attributes.action: Include cycle paths in post-Brexit farming subsidies
attributes.background: Rewarding farmers for providing cycle paths across farmland, would offer safe routes to schools and work, connecting villages and towns. This would reduce pollution, provide leisure opportunities, compensate for lost bus services and contribute to the well being of the nation.

attributes.action: Include courses on the awareness of terminal illnesses in schools
attributes.background: Include courses in the PSHE curriculum to teach children about terminal illnesses in our schools, and how to deal with them.
attributes.additional_details: Many children do not know how to react to and deal with a family member, friend, or themselves being diagnosed with terminal illnesses such as cancer.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health services exempt from VAT.
attributes.background: Mental Health services such as Addiction Counselling (Food, Drugs, Alcohol etc), Psychotherapy and Trauma Counselling currently are all deemed as VATable expenses which makes them a “Luxury Item” this means that Thousands of people are having to pay extra for the help they desperately need!
attributes.additional_details: Currently services such as Equine Therapy, Art Therapy and Speech Therapy are all VAT Exempt so why not important potentially life saving/ changing services? If this government is serious about helping people with mental health issues then drop the VAT and help to make the services they need more affordable.

attributes.action: Go back to the old GCSEs and abolish the new 9-1 Grading system
attributes.background: The new GCSEs are incredibly difficult and it results in many students failing or getting low grades. The new system has set students for failure and has even increased the difficulty to that of the old A-levels. This is inconsiderate and unjust. We must abolish this system.

attributes.action: Ban Vaping in public places, vaping to be included in the smoking tobacco act
attributes.background: Treat vaping with the same laws as tobacco smoking, there are toxic fumes coming from vaping, teenagers who vape could move onto cigarettes,  there will be health issues in the future if we allow this trend to continue,  let us try a curb it now before its too late,
attributes.additional_details: I'm not asking for an outright ban, only in public places

attributes.action: Stop the purchase of gas boilers and associated parts without a registration.
attributes.background: If the law stated, that selling and buying both domestic and commercial Gas, Oil and LPG boilers and associated parts, without governing body registrations became law, the dangerous practice of unqualified and dangerous installations would cease. Thus improving the safety for all and save lives.

attributes.action: Giving the British people the right to remove members of the Lords by petition.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition because some of the unelected members of the Lords are ignoring the will of the British people and acting in their own interests. There is no participation by the British people in who is appointed to the Lords. In a real democracy there should be a way to remove them .
attributes.additional_details: I help run a large Community Hall and a significant number of the membership when asked about the interference of the Lords into the EU referendum cannot understand why they are not answerable to anyone.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for drivers to hit and run when hitting a domestic animal
attributes.background: This point needs to be put into action because domesticated animals being killed with no justice is no option and should be a criminal offence. When an animal companion is removed it leaves people feeling very alone and broken, looking for justice that currently can’t be served - personal experience

attributes.action: Put pressure on the U.K. Government to condemn child sex trafficking in India.
attributes.background:
The Independent recently wrote an article about child sex trafficking in India and how big of an issue it is. The article highlighted just how big of a problem sex trafficking is in India. 
 
We urge the U.K Government to condemn this and urge the Indian government to take action.
attributes.additional_details: If you would like to read more on the issue here is a link attached: https://breakthechainscampaign.wordpress.com/2017/12/08/sexual-exploitation/

attributes.action: Increase the Speed Limit on motorways between 11pm and 6am to 80 mph for cars.
attributes.background: During the night the motorway network is used less. Vehicles are now much better equipped with safety features to travel faster. Increasing the speed limit at night will encourage more travelling at this time and less congestion during the day. It would promote quicker and safer travelling at night.
attributes.additional_details: The National Speed Limit of 70mph on motorways was first introduced on a trial basis in 1965 and became permanent in 1967. The current 70mph limit has now been in place for over 50 years.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to have sprinklers in all schools in the United Kingdom
attributes.background:
Childrens lives are being put at risk because new schools or refurbished school since 2014 do not have to have sprinklers fitted
In Scotland and Wales it is mandatory so it should be the same for English and Northern Irish schools
attributes.additional_details:
The National Fire Chiefs Council believe all schools should be fitted as seen in this BBC article dated 25 October 2017
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41744582
The DfE's "expectation that all new schools will have sprinklers fitted", unless a school is "low risk" and installation "would not be good value for money".
Despite this, less than a third of the 260 schools built since 2014 under the Schools Building Programme have sprinklers

attributes.action: Make Battle of Britain Day, the 15th of September, a public holiday.
attributes.background: Let the 15th of September as "Battle of Britain Day" be made a public holiday to celebrate that one day in the field of human conflict that represents that grand singularity of the unity of purpose of the diverse peoples of this great nation that says 'together we are'.
attributes.additional_details:
The Battle of Britain, as fought between the 10th of July and the 31st of October, 1940, was summed up by Winston Churchill with the words "Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few". 

On the 15th of September, 1940, the Luftwaffe embarked on its largest bombing attack yet, which required the engagement of the entirety of the RAF in defence of London and the South East, resulting in a decisive British victory that marked the turning point in Britain's favour.

attributes.action: stop car insurance companies increasing premiums for no-fault accidents
attributes.background: I had two non fault accidents where the other drivers crashed into me, after which they both admitted fault. However my car insurance company still increased my premiums and called me high risk. I did not claim and at the time of each accident I was driving a company vehicle under company insurance.
attributes.additional_details: I am a class one driver and every year I have to sit a CPC course just to keep my class one license. I also have 11 years NCB on one car and 9 years on another car. I drive every day for my job and do more miles in a week than more people do in a month. But this is done in a company vehicle under company insurance.

attributes.action: Increase Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) from 39 weeks to 52 weeks
attributes.background: It is important that new parents should not be put off taking their full entitlement to Maternity Leave for 52 weeks because they will not receive payment for the last 13 weeks of their leave. Currently SMP is only payable for the first 39 weeks of Maternity Leave.
attributes.additional_details:
The House of Commons Library contains a document entitled "Maternity pay and leave" dated 13 January 2010. It states that in December 2004 the Government announced a goal of extending maternity pay to twelve
months, from what was then 26 weeks (6 months). Although progress has been made and maternity pay is now paid for 39 weeks (9 months), I believe it is an important social issue to get that extra extension to 52 weeks (12 months).

attributes.action: Brexit deal must contain a clause allowing us rejoin the EU on the same terms
attributes.background:
As a form of insurance against a potentially destructive Brexit we the undersigned petition the government to include a clause in any deal with the EU to allow us to rejoin on the exact same terms we are on now.

This will give us the ultimate get out clause if Brexit is as damaging as predicted.

attributes.action: Invest more money in youth charities and youth service providers in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a profound reduction in services for young people resulting from funding cuts. With huge pressures on all local authority budgets, these cuts won’t be reversed. We have to support the organisations who help young people from areas with high levels of deprivation and low income backgrounds.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2012, in London alone at least £22 million has been cut from council youth service budgets and 12,700 places for young people have been lost. The average council has cut its youth service budget by nearly £1 million, an average of 36%. (London's Lost Youth Services, 2017).

Across the country more than 1 in 10 think their life will amount to nothing, no matter how hard they try. 42% of young people feel traditional goals like getting a steady job are unrealistic (Prince's Trust, 2017).

attributes.action: Offer legal aid for all women/ men who have been a victim of domestic abuse
attributes.background: Legal aid is not currently available to all domestic abuse survivors. There are very specific conditions you must meet to be valid, which does not take into consideration any financial abuse or manipulation, which has left a lot of victims struggling to pay off debt and get divorced at the same time

attributes.action: Any NEWSPAPER to be bound like BBC: to be fair, balanced, truthful and accurate.
attributes.background: At top of cover page, all publications to declare themselves to be a Newspaper, or Propaganda Sheet, Party Political publication, Advertising material, Lifestyle magazine, Specific Interest Publication. We need to know what we buy, just as we differentiate between reportage and advertisement.
attributes.additional_details:
The reason for this need is the existence of daily publications which:
•	deliberately distort their reporting by selection of facts, 
•	selectively headline items with a disproportionate emphasis on some topics, 
•	repeat items as if they were new or current when they are not, 
•	use biased, inflammatory or pejorative language, 
•	set a tone which encourages divisiveness and prejudice against particular groups or beliefs.
This is a serious and growing problem, today and in recent years.

attributes.action: Create a body to mediate between Insolvency Practioners and those in an IVA.
attributes.background: An IVA typically lasts 5 or 6 years and the debtor  must use the services of an Insolvency Practitioner (IP). Once signed up they are bound to that IP, regardless of quality of service. they have no access to mediation. See https://www.iva.co.uk/forum/another-petition-f145-t83980 for background.
attributes.additional_details: Where there is a dispute between a creditor and debtor, the debtor can turn to the Financial Ombudsman for mediation / resolution. However, in an IVA there is no mechanism for mediation / resolution. The debtor has to rely on the insolvency firms complaints procedure and then the IP’s regulatory body.  BUT … the regulatory bodies do not intervene. They will not alter or make an IP alter their course of action, even if proven incorrect. The debtor gets no restitution nor is the dispute settled
